subject: Re: testing void method
msgSnippet: ... Does the method do something useful? ;- If calling the method produces some useful result, then you can test that result.  (Otherwise, you could stop
messageBody:
--- "Jignesh" <jignesh.patel@t...> wrote:
> I have a method which is returning void. How to test it with junit.
> -Jignesh

Does the method do something useful?
;->


If calling the method produces some useful result, then you can test
that result. (Otherwise, you could stop calling the method; indeed,
you could even delete it! ;-) A *method* that returns void probably
changes the state of the object in some other way. Test the changed
state.

For example, "set" methods typically return void. You can test "setX"
by calling it, and verify that the result of "getX" changed. [This is
just an example. Testing get and set methods is typically a waste of
time. I'll assume that your void-return-method does something *non-
trivial* and useful.]
